# Insulation Training Curriculum  
**Revision 2.2 — 29 May 2025 (Europe/Paris)**  

---

## Program Snapshot
* **Duration:** 5 intensive days (Phase 1) + 30‑day field implementation window (optional Phase 2)  
* **Daily Rhythm:** **I**nformation → **S**tudio (hands‑on) → **B**usiness/Customer Lab  
* **Outcome:** Dual‑level certification, micro‑grants for top 3 performers, alumni tool‑library access  

---

## Table 1 – Core Learning Objectives by Day

| Day | Theme | Learning Objectives |
|-----|-------|---------------------|
| **1** | Understanding Heat Flow & Assessment | • Identify & measure conduction, convection, radiation • Debunk 5 common myths with IR & smoke‑pen demos • Systematically audit a home with provided spreadsheet • Run first ROI calc for roof coating • Map pain → price linkages |
| **2** | Roof Interventions (≈ 70 % Impact) | • Quantify roof heat gain & savings (ASHRAE adj.) • Select & apply roof coatings; run scratch‑adhesion test • Calculate coverage, labour, hidden costs • Extend ROI to roof + wall combo • Plan quote for two customer types |
| **3** | Wall Solutions & Systems | • Compare Perlite “Labkh”, EPS “Filline”, ICF for new build • Mix & apply renders/panels; avoid key mistakes • Build complete BOM & labour matrix • Downsize AC & design trade‑in offer • Add full‑service menu to business model |
| **4** | Air Sealing & Ventilation | • Detect & seal leaks; operate blower door (if available) • Model natural ventilation with cardboard house & smoke • Decide seal vs vent via simple rules & anemometer data • Calculate rooftop‑vent ROI • Size Mosul market & map first niche |
| **5** | Sales Engineering & Business Launch | • Collect credible data (photo, temp‑log, testimonial) • Finalise 90‑day cash‑flow & marketing plan • Pitch to panel; receive Phase 1 certification • Top 3 awarded micro‑grants • Prep Phase 2 evidence checklist |

---

## Table 2 – Participant Personas & Goals

| Persona | Background | Challenge | Training Goal | Expected Outcome |
|---------|------------|-----------|---------------|------------------|
| Recent Graduate Engineer | Civil/Mechanical degree | No practical site experience | Gain hands‑on credibility + business basics | Junior engineer or start-up |
| Construction Worker | 5 + years on site | Wants higher wages | Add insulation specialty | Crew supervisor |
| Small Contractor | Runs 3–5 crew | Losing bids without insulation | Expand offer | Win more contracts |
| Unemployed Professional | Various | Needs new income path | Pivot into insulation trade | Launch micro‑business |

---

## Table 3 – Trainer Reference Guide

| Trainer | Background | Key Insight | Signature Story |
|---------|------------|-------------|-----------------|
| Ghassan | 6 yr in field, Turkish agency | 60–70 % roof heat | 90 % of Mosul homes abandon 2nd floor in summer |
| Muthanna Al‑Mashhadani | Northern Technical Univ. + Al‑Hadaf | “People think electricity is free” | Client halved gas bill post‑insulation |
| Omar Laith | Al‑Rafdeen Engineering | Trust through guarantees | Promised 10 °C drop, delivered 17 °C, invited to client’s wedding |
| Aya Nizar Basheer | Aswar Al‑Mosul (100 + ICF homes) | ICF keeps AC off 1 h | ICF adds only ≈ 10 % to build cost |

---

## Materials & Tools

### Minimal Field Kit (per training group)

| Category | Items |
|---|---|
| **Assessment** | IR thermometer × 1, tape × 2, smoke pencils × 4, printed audit forms × 20 |
| **Application** | Mixing buckets × 4, trowel/float sets × 4, paint rollers × 4, basic PPE |
| **Documentation** | Smartphone with camera, notebooks & pens |

### Optimal Training‑Centre Kit

| Category | Items |
|---|---|
| **Advanced Assessment** | FLIR‑type IR camera, blower door, data loggers × 4, anemometer |
| **Professional Tools** | Mixer drill, spray rig, scaffolding, full PPE sets |
| **Business** | Laptop with templates, printer, sample material library |

---

## Detailed 5+1‑Day Schedule

### Day 1 – Understanding Heat Flow & Assessment  
*Morning (**I**)*  
- Ice‑breaker: **5‑Myth Quiz**  
- Demo strip: IR camera on wall/ceiling; smoke‑pen convection reveal  
- Ghassan’s abandonment story (5 min)  

*Project Studio (**S**)*  
- Use **Home‑Audit Spreadsheet v1** on training room  
- Measure baseline temps & leak spots; capture orthogonal photos (N/E/S/W)  
- Optional blower‑door run (if device available)  

*Business / Customer Lab (**B**)*  
- Build **Pain‑to‑Price Worksheet** (productivity, health, relationship stress)  
- First ROI tab: single roof‑coating intervention  

---

### Day 2 – Roof Interventions: The 70 % Solution  
*Morning I*  
- Science of roof heat gain; warranty sheets & scratch test (clean vs dusty)  
- Omar’s 17 °C victory video (rights cleared)  

*Studio S*  
- Mix & apply 4 coating types; measure coverage; labour‑hour stopwatch  
- Calculate material needs for 150 m² roof  

*Business Lab B*  
- Extend ROI sheet → roof + wall scenario  
- Customer archetypes: **Price‑Sensitive** vs **Comfort‑Driven**  
- Enter labour & material cost lines  

---

### Day 3 – Wall Solutions & Systems  
*Morning I*  
- ICF reality check (new builds only)  
- Perlite “Labkh”, EPS “Filline”, cement insulating plasters demo  
- Muthanna’s gas‑bill story  

*Studio S*  
- Hands‑on mixing & application; panel mounting practice  
- AC down‑size & trade‑in calculator exercise  

*Business Lab B*  
- Complete full **BOM & Time Estimator**  
- Add business expenses (transport, tools, insurance)  
- Profit‑margin slider in ROI workbook  

---

### Day 4 – Air Sealing & Ventilation  
*Morning I*  
- Hidden costs of infiltration (NTU 2024)  
- Seal vs Vent rules; cardboard model with fans & incense; Aya’s ICF story  

*Studio S*  
- Two‑station rotation (trainer + assistant): crack‑sealing & vent‑sizing  
- Measure airflow with anemometer; temp strips show stratification  

*Business Lab B*  
- **Vent‑ROI Tab**: airflow × ΔT × hours_off_generator × fuel_cost  
- Mosul market sizing (500 k households); neighbourhood mapping  
- Choose first niche & draft WhatsApp flyer / mosque announcement  

---

### Day 5 – Sales Engineering & Business Launch  
*Morning I*  
- Portfolio evidence protocol: orthogonal photos, temp logs, testimonials  
- Omar’s wedding invitation story → longevity of quality work  

*Studio S*  
- Mock client pitches with Problem‑Solution cards & testimonial videos  
- Panel assessment → **Phase 1 Certification**  

*Business Lab B*  
- Fill Business Model Canvas; 90‑day cash‑flow projection  
- Tool‑library shared‑cost calculator  
- **Micro‑Grant Ceremony**: top 3 each receive US $500 / $250 / $250  

---

### Optional Day 6 – Field Challenge (within 30 days)  
Participants implement a real project:  
1. Spend micro‑grant or self‑finance  
2. Submit evidence (before/after photos, temp logs, client testimonial)  
3. Earn **Phase 2 Advanced Certificate**  
*Others may partner or self‑fund to qualify.*  

---

## Assessment & Certification Framework

| Requirement | Phase 1 | Phase 2 |
|-------------|---------|---------|
| Financial‑literacy post‑test ≥ 70 % | ✅ | — |
| Complete Home‑Audit Spreadsheet | ✅ | — |
| Pass Mock Sales Pitch | ✅ | — |
| Quality install demo (studio) | ✅ | — |
| Field implementation w/ evidence | — | ✅ |
| Alumni network participation | ✅ | ✅ |

---

## Appendices

### Appendix A – Home‑Audit Spreadsheet  
Google‑Sheets template provided; printed version supplied. Tabs: Rooms, Roof, Walls, Air‑leaks, ROI‑calc.

### Appendix B – ROI Workbook (progressive)  
Tabs unlocked each day: Roof → Walls → Vent → Full Package → Cash‑Flow.

### Appendix C – Roof‑Assessment Checklist (v2)  
- Substrate cleanliness □ Pass □ Fail  
- Ponding zones (m²): ____  
- Expansion joints OK? □ Yes □ No  
- Tile‑removal area (m²): ____  
- **Warranty sheet captured?** □ Photo □ PDF (Brand/Term ____)  
- Compatible primer? □ Yes □ No  
- Solar‑ready conduit? □ Yes □ No  

### Appendix D – Data Collection Protocol  
1. **Orthogonal (“straight‑on”) photos** of each façade/roof.  
2. Temp logger (1 min interval) before/after 48 h.  
3. Client quote on comfort/energy.  
4. Upload to shared Google Drive folder.

### Appendix E – Tools Glossary  
*IR Camera*, *Smoke Pencil*, **Anemometer** – hand‑held vane measuring air‑speed (m/s) to quantify vent airflow for ROI, *Blower Door*, *Thermo Strips*, etc.

---

## References

1. Northern Technical University. “**Air Leakage in Iraqi Residential Buildings**.” 2024.  
2. ASHRAE Handbook—Fundamentals (2021 lat‑adj.).  
3. Turkish Building Materials Association. “**Perlite Render Thermal Performance.**” 2023.  
4. Mosul Electricity Directorate. “**Generator Fuel Cost Survey.**” 2024.

---

*Prepared by: Bilal & Curriculum Team*  
*© 2025 Practical Energy Lab – All rights reserved.*
